revision.text:
[[Image:Ladenburg um 1900.jpg|thumb|250px|Ladenburg in 1900]]
''This article is about the Town. For the [[German|Germany]] [[Chemist]], see [[Albert Ladenburg]]''
'''Ladenburg''' is a town in the district of [[Rhein-Neckar-Kreis]], in [[Baden-Württemberg]], [[Germany]]. It is situated on the right bank of the [[Neckar]], 10 km east of [[Mannheim]], and 10 km northwest of [[Heidelberg]].

68526 Ladenburg |Website = [http://www.ladenburg.de/ www.ladenburg.de] |Bürgermeister = Rainer Ziegler |Partei = SPD }} [[Image:Ladenburg um 1900.jpg|thumb|left|220px|Ladenburg in 1900.]] {{Two other uses|German town|investment bank|Ladenburg Thalmann|German chemist|Albert Ladenburg}} '''Ladenburg''' is a town in the district of [[Rhein-Neckar-Kreis]], in [[Baden-Württemberg]], [[Germany]]. It is situated on the right bank of the [[Neckar]], 10 km east of [[Mannheim]], and 10 km northwest of [[Heidelberg]]. It has an old town from the Late Middle Ages. Its history dates back to Celtic and Roman ages. Ladenburg is located on [[Bertha Benz Memorial Route]]. == Notable people == * The Bavarian war ministers [[Franz Xaver von Hertling|Franz Xaver]] and [[Friedrich von Hertling]] were born in Ladenburg. * The man who is regarded as the inventor of the automobile, [[Karl Benz]], spent the last days of his life in Ladenburg between 1906 and his death in 1929. == History == The first time this village was populated was between 3000 and 200 BC. It then consisted of a Celtic setlement Lokudunum (="Seatower"). In the year 40 the Romans populated the town as a farmer/militarian outpost. It was then called Suebi Nicrense ("Neckarsuebi") by the Roman sources. In 74 AD the Romans founded the town Auxiliarkastelle which included a supply-keeping town, which was the center of the future town. The garison included a kavlary of the Canaefaten. ==External links== {{Commonscat|Ladenburg}} * [http://www.automuseum-dr-carl-benz.de/ Automuseum Dr. Carl Benz] * [http://www.bertha-benz.de/indexen.php?inhalt=home/ Bertha Benz Memorial Route]

68526 Ladenburg |Website = [http://www.ladenburg.de/ www.ladenburg.de] |Bürgermeister = Rainer Ziegler |Partei = SPD }} [[Image:Ladenburg um 1900.jpg|thumb|left|220px|Ladenburg in 1900.]] {{Two other uses|German town|investment bank|Ladenburg Thalmann|German chemist|Albert Ladenburg}} '''Ladenburg''' is a town in the district of [[Rhein-Neckar-Kreis]], in [[Baden-Württemberg]], [[Germany]]. It is situated on the right bank of the [[Neckar]], 10 km east of [[Mannheim]], and 10 km northwest of [[Heidelberg]]. It has an old town from the Late Middle Ages. Its history dates back to Celtic and Roman ages. Ladenburg is located on [[Bertha Benz Memorial Route]]. == Notable people == * The Bavarian war ministers [[Franz Xaver von Hertling|Franz Xaver]] and [[Friedrich von Hertling]] were born in Ladenburg. * The man who is regarded as the inventor of the automobile, [[Karl Benz]], spent the last days of his life in Ladenburg between 1906 and his death in 1929. == History == The first time this village was populated was between 3000 and 200 BC. It then consisted of a Celtic setlement Lokudunum (="Seatower"). In the year 40 the Romans populated the town as a farmer/militarian outpost. It was then called Suebi Nicrense ("Neckarsuebi") by the Roman sources. In 74 AD the Romans founded the town Auxiliarkastelle which included a supply-keeping town, which was the center of the future town. The garison included a kavlary of the Canaefaten. ==External links== {{Commonscat|Ladenburg}} * [http://www.automuseum-dr-carl-benz.de/ Automuseum Dr. Carl Benz] * [http://www.bertha-benz.de/indexen.php?inhalt=home/ Bertha Benz Memorial Route]

{{Expand German|topic=geo|date=February 2009|Ladenburg}} {{Infobox German location |Name = Ladenburg |Art = town |image_photo = Automuseum Dr Carl Benz.jpg |image_caption = [[Carl Benz]] Museum |Wappen = Wappen Ladenburg.png |lat_deg = 49 |lat_min = 28 |lon_deg = 8 |lon_min = 37 |Lageplan = Ladenburg in HD.svg |Bundesland = Baden-Württemberg |Regierungsbezirk = Karlsruhe |Landkreis = Rhein-Neckar-Kreis |Höhe = 106 |Fläche = 19 |Einwohner = 11510 |Stand = |pop_source = |PLZ = 68520–68526 |PLZ-alt = |Vorwahl = 06203 |Kfz = HD |Gemeindeschlüssel = 08 2 26 038 |Gliederung = Town with hamlet |Adresse = Hauptstraße 7
68526 Ladenburg |Website = [http://www.ladenburg.de/ www.ladenburg.de] |Bürgermeister = Rainer Ziegler |Partei = SPD }} [[File:Ladenburg um 1900.jpg|thumb|left|220px|Ladenburg in 1900.]] {{Two other uses|the German town|the investment bank|Ladenburg Thalmann|the German chemist|Albert Ladenburg}} '''Ladenburg''' is a town in the district of [[Rhein-Neckar-Kreis]], in [[Baden-Württemberg]], [[Germany]]. It is situated on the right bank of the [[Neckar]], 10 km east of [[Mannheim]], and 10 km northwest of [[Heidelberg]]. It has an old town from the Late Middle Ages. Its history dates back to Celtic and Roman ages. Ladenburg is located on [[Bertha Benz Memorial Route]]. ==Notable people== * The Bavarian war ministers [[Franz Xaver von Hertling|Franz Xaver]] and [[Friedrich von Hertling]] were born in Ladenburg. * The man who is regarded as the inventor of the automobile, [[Karl Benz]], spent the last days of his life in Ladenburg between 1906 and his death in 1929. ==History== The first time this village was populated was between 3000 and 200 BC. It then consisted of a Celtic settlement Lopodunum (="Seatower"). In the year 40 the Romans populated the town as a farmer/military outpost and kept its Celtic name. The local territory formed the civilian district of ''Civitas Ulpia Sueborum Nicretum'' ("Neckarsuebi"), of which Lopodunum was the chief town. In 74 AD the Romans founded the town Auxiliarkastelle which included a supply-keeping town, which was the center of the future town. The garrison included a cavalry of the Canaefaten. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Ladenburg}} * [http://www.automuseum-dr-carl-benz.de/ Automuseum Dr. Carl Benz] * [http://www.bertha-benz.de/indexen.php?inhalt=home/ Bertha Benz Memorial Route]

It is situated on the right bank of the [[Neckar]], {{convert|10|km|0|abbr=off}} east of [[Mannheim]], and {{convert|10|km|0|abbr=on}} northwest of [[Heidelberg]]. Ladenburg's history dates back to Celtic and Roman ages. In Roman times it was called 'Lopodunum'. Emperor [[Trajan]] elevated it to the status of a city ('[[civitas]]') in the year [[98]]. It has an old town from the Late Middle Ages. Ladenburg is located on [[Bertha Benz Memorial Route]]. ==Mayors== List of mayors:''Ladenburg-Lexikon''. Norderstedt 2007, ISBN 978-3-8334-6799-8. {| | valign="top" | * 1914–1922: Wilhelm Fritsch * 1922–1931: Christian Koch ([[Social Democratic Party of Germany|SPD]]) * 1931–1933: Hermann Hagen * 1933–1934: Alfred Reuther ([[NSDAP]]) * 1934–1945: Kurt Pohly (NSDAP) | valign="top" | * 1945–1953: Adam Herdt ([[Christian Democratic Union (Germany)|CDU]]) * 1953–1965: [[Hermann Hohn]] ([[Free Voters|FWV]]) * 1965–1993: Reinhold Schulz (SPD) * 1993–2001: Rolf Reble (CDU) * since 2001: Rainer Ziegler (SPD) |} ==Notable people== * The Bavarian war ministers [[Franz Xaver von Hertling|Franz Xaver]] and [[Friedrich von Hertling]] were born in Ladenburg. * The man who is regarded as the inventor of the automobile, [[Karl Benz]], spent the last days of his life in Ladenburg between 1906 and his death in 1929. ==History== The first time this village was populated was between 3000 and 200 BC. It then consisted of a Celtic settlement Lopodunum (="Seatower"). In the year 40 the Romans populated the town as a farmer/military outpost and kept its Celtic name. The local territory formed the civilian district of ''Civitas Ulpia Sueborum Nicretum'' ("Neckarsuebi"), of which Lopodunum was the chief town. In 74 AD the Romans founded the town Auxiliarkastelle which included a supply-keeping town, which was the center of the future town. The garrison included a cavalry of the Canaefaten. ==International relations== {{See also|List of twin towns and sister cities in Germany}} ===Twin towns – Sister cities=== Ladenburg is [[Twin towns and sister cities|twinned]] with: * {{flagicon|BFA}} [[Garango]], Burkina Faso{{cite web | url =https://sites.google.com/site/lavalgarango/ | title = Jumelage Laval-Garango | accessdate = 2013-06-13|language = French}} * {{flagicon|AUT}} [[Paternion]], Austria{{cite web | url = https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paternion | title = Paternion-Ladenburg | accessdate = 2013-12-13|language = English}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Ladenburg}} * [http://www.automuseum-dr-carl-benz.de/ Automuseum Dr. Carl Benz] * [http://www.bertha-benz.de/indexen.php?inhalt=home/ Bertha Benz Memorial Route]
